item.title: Islanders' Boychuk agrees to terms on new contract
item.description:
The New York Islanders announced Thursday that defenseman Johnny Boychuk has agreed to terms on a seven-year contract.
Financial details of the contract were not released, but Newsday reported the value of the contract is $42 million, for a $6 ...

item.title: Islanders' Boychuk agrees to seven-year deal
item.description:
The New York Islanders announced today that defenseman Johnny Boychuk has agreed to terms on a seven-year deal, signing through the 2021-22 season.
Boychuk, 31, leads all Islanders defensemen in points (32), assists (25) and plus-minus rating (...

item.title: Flyers sign forward Bardreau to entry-level contract
item.description:
The Philadelphia Flyers have signed forward Cole Bardreau to a three-year entry-level contract beginning with the start of the 2015-16 season, according to general manager Ron Hextall.
Bardreau, 21, recently completed a four-year career at Cor...

item.title: Columbus Blue Jackets activate defenceman Ryan Murray after missing 5 weeks with ankle sprain
item.description:
COLUMBUS, Ohio - The Columbus Blue Jackets have activated defenceman Ryan Murray off injured reserve after he missed five weeks with a high ankle sprain.
Murray was hurt in a game against St. Louis on Feb. 6.
The 21-year-old picked No. 2 o...

item.title: Parenteau returns to Canadiens lineup after agent tweets: Therrien says timing right
item.description:

item.title: Rangers' Klein to meet with doctor after shot block
item.description:
New York Rangers defenseman Kevin Klein has returned to New York to meet with a team physician after blocking a shot Wednesday against the Washington Capitals, the Rangers announced Thursday.

item.title: Maple Leafs recall defenseman Brennan from AHL
item.description:
The Toronto Maple Leafs announced today that defenseman TJ Brennan has been recalled from the Toronto Marlies (AHL).

item.title: Islanders' Leddy will miss at least two weeks: report
item.description:
New York Islanders defenseman Nick Leddy will be out at least two weeks because of an upper-body injury, according to Newsday.
Leddy was injured during the second period of the Islanders' game Monday against the Toronto Maple Leafs, and he did ...

item.description:

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Roberts to work with new sports performance center
item.description:
Former NHL player Gary Roberts announced plans Wednesday for a familiar role of off-ice instruction in his return to Pennsylvania.

item.description:

item.title: Maple Leafs send Nazem Kadri home before practice for missing team meeting
item.description:

item.title: Panthers' Luongo won't return Thursday: report
item.description:
Florida Panthers goalie Roberto Luongo will miss a third straight game Thursday against the Winnipeg Jets, according to the Miami Herald.

item.title: Maple Leafs to hold Kadri out two more games
item.description:
TORONTO -- Toronto Maple Leafs center Nazem Kadri will not play in their next two games, team president Brendan Shanahan announced Wednesday.

item.description:

Then he found his opening.

item.title: McNabb has goal, 2 assists and Quick stops 21 shots as Kings beat Avalanche 5-2
item.description:

item.title: Lamoriello not on Devils bench but role unchanged
item.description:
ST. PAUL, Minn. -- Lou Lamoriello was not on the bench for the New Jersey Devils on Tuesday against the Minnesota Wild but said his role as co-coach has not changed.
He watched the Devils' 6-2 loss from the press box; co-coaches Adam Oates and ...

item.title: Tuuka Rask makes 39 saves as Bruins beat Sens for third straight win
item.description:
OTTAWA - Tuukka Rask stopped 39 shots to lead the Boston Bruins to a 3-1 win over the Ottawa Senators on Tuesday night.
Ottawa native Ryan Spooner scored twice for the Bruins (34-22-10), who won their third straight. Loui Eriksson added the o...

item.title: Johansen's shootout goal leads Blue Jackets over Hurricanes 4-3, hold onto playoff position
item.description:

item.title: Eric Tangradi scores in overtime as Bulldogs edge Flames 2-1
item.description:

item.title: Fiddler scores winning goal in Dallas Stars 2-1 victory over free-falling Philadelphia Flyers
item.description:
PHILADELPHIA - Vernon Fiddler scored the go-ahead goal late in the third period to lift the Dallas Stars to a 2-1 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers on Tuesday night.
Brett Ritchie also scored for the Stars, who won for just the fourth time...

item.description:

item.title: Rangers agree to terms with Tambellini on contract
item.description:
The New York Rangers agreed to terms Tuesday with forward Adam Tambellini on an entry-level contract, the team announced. Terms were not disclosed.
Tambellini was selected by the Rangers in the third round (No. 65) of the 2013 NHL Draft.

item.title: Flyers sign forward Martel to entry-level contract
item.description:
The Philadelphia Flyers have signed 5-8, 162-lb C Danick Martel to a three-year entry-level contract, according to general manager Ron Hextall.
